name: Makayla Davis
text: it is very fun we go there on our jet skis

name: John Porter
text: Best experienced by kayak or boat, usually local boaters gather all weekend for a stretch of the legs and whatnot. Toss back a cold one in the cool water, let the kids cavort in the sandy shallows between boats under watchful eyes of mamas and daddys, while social distancing means keeping a spot open for the kids while maximizing landing space. The easily offended won't tary long, but most are hardworking citizens momentarily letting their hair down down, respect should be supplied. Keep an eye out for kids in the drink and occasionally those who've not gotten their landlegs secured yet, Arrrr.

name: Chris Wallace
text: Beautiful day at Hippy Beach

name: Dana Mcglaun-martinez
text: Nice and clean no crowd

name: Joe Richerson
text: What a great piece of property

name: Kristina Harrington
text: Love love!

name: MeChelle Brooke
text: There were a bunch of people partying on boats, they yelled my my family saying we had to leave. My nephews just wanted to fish.

name: Sandy Rosson
text: Nice

name: MEg Sarazine
text: Quiet secluded Beach area. Sadly there is garbage around - not like any Hippies I know!

name: Jeannie Scarlett
text: Could not find.. even with GPS.

name: Ronnie Cliburn
text: Great place to bring the kids to play in the water.

name: Ryan Maxie
text: Been going here since I was a teenager, pretty cool place off of the beat and path.

name: Tina Millar
text: Went kayaking had a blast just have to be careful of the boats

name: jonathan brown
text: Dont trash the beach!

name: Larry Saunders
text: Awesome place to take the family

name: Alabama Lucey
text: Just a little beachy area.  Gets cramped when a lot of boats show up.

name: Rhonda McAdams
text: Love this place!!!❣

name: Hirby Meaux
text: Great

name: Leyton Hudson
text: It is amazing overall great time and on the beach 🏖️

name: Jody Rieck
text: Great place to rent right off the beach!

name: Bradley Wihebrink
text: We absolutely loved the Seabrier. You couldn't get much closer to the beach than this house. Teresa (owner) was super friendly and does a great job of making sure that you are happy with their home. Awesome price for a week stay and very out of the way from the tourist areas of Gulf Shores. Be prepared to drive over 30 minutes to get to town but I didn't mind as I wanted to be away from it all and close to the Fort Morgan historical site too. We will most likely be return visitors given that our schedules allow us to return in future years. It is not a mansion sized house or a luxury modern home however it is plenty nice enough for our little family. Pull out beds, trundle bed, day bed, bunk beds, full bed, and queen makes for more than enough sleeping areas. Call Teresa and talk with her to put yourself at ease and then....get your butt down to the beach already!!

name: Lisa Mitchell
text: We loved our stay at the Seabrier. The owners were prompt and fantastic to work with. The beds were all so comfortable. The kitchen had everything you need  (including spices and some condiments) If your traveling with littles there is an abundance of sand toys and even a few chairs provided. We look forward to staying here again!

name: Jerry Kall
text: Clean, quiet and close to the beach. Takes a bit to get here, but once you have made the journey it is worth it. Be a blessing and make a memory.

name: Devin Haynes
text: Great house and beautiful beach!

name: annette Austin
text: Very nice place to stay

name: Jessica Dingler
text: Very nice place

name: Jennifer Dove
text:
Overall a nice place to stay. Convenient to everything. House was nice, air conditioning worked very well which is a huge bonus. Most houses that we have rented, didn't cool as well as this one. I know this seems small,, but it had no oven mitts at all which made it a little hard making things in the oven. We always cook breakfast in the room. It was well stocked with coffee cups, plates and silverware. I also think that they should provide more than 2 bath towels and 2 wash cloths per bathroom. I normally reuse my towel, but had to wash my wash cloths after every shower. The house was clean and the beds were comfortable.
When we look for a house to rent we normally look for a private pool. This one we had to share with 3 other 4 bedroom houses. I have to say that this pool is plenty big enough. We never felt crowded at all.
We would definitely stay here again.

name: Waldo Nooner
text: Beautifully appointed beach house. Twenty of us gathered to celebrate my mom's 80th birthday. We rented the 8 bedroom house. The availability of an elevator is what mage us choose this property. It was very clean. The large kitchen and great roomenabled us to entertain and not feel crowded at all. From age 86 to 9 months old. What a memorable trip.

name: Ernest Bentley
text: Luxurious rental homes with amazing views. Staff is the best, especially Rachel and Kay.

name: Briel Vanderwerff
text: DON"T VACATION WITH THEM THEY ARE EVIL PEOPLE THAT TAKE INNOCENCE VACATIONERS MONEY! They offered a credit due to Covid and then revoked through an email. They won't answer phone calls or reply to emails!

name: Tanga Lawler
text: My family and I will RETURN

name: Eddie Gilbert
text: This place is amazing we came here the week of 4th of july on our company trip and everyone had a blast short walk to the beach and your own pool this place can appease the whole crowd regardless of age , it even has an elevator. Will definitely be back next year

name: Adeeb Saleh
text: We had a great family reunion at one of their rentals. Very courteous owners who quickly respond. Highly recommend

name: Kendall Toews
text: Loved our time here please was clean and had lots of room nice board walk to the beach. Only complaint was the pools aren't heated and unit 8 pool is never in the sun.

name: Melissa Dedina
text: The house itself was lovely, plenty of space for our large group, but most of all - when we discovered after driving away that our daughter had lost her much loved doll, the owners were kind enough to look for it and overnight it to us before we left the country a few days later. Five stars for going above and beyond :)

name: Sherry Berman
text: Heading out this week for Beach Music houses. Had a family reunion there last year and decided to come back this year. The  owner is spectacular in response time. Great house, great beach. Great Time

name: MORJOY LLC
text: Great experience, overall. Owners are gracious and accommodating. Houses are spacious & especially well laid out for large groups. Location is spectacular!

name: Geo Bits
text: Great location and rental. Elevator doesn't always work right, but other than that it's a great place

name: Patricia Smith
text: Our 2nd time renting one of these wonderful places.  Love, love, love it here.  Manager was a dream to work with and more than willing to answer any questions we had.  An Orange Beach jewel.

name: Amy Pfitzinger
text: The location was great but the management staff was very disorganized. We had our wedding there and was expecting a stress free and happy experience. Prior to going we had multiple conversations with many different people who worked there indicating that everything was going to be great and taken care of. However, when we got there it was nothing but stress and lack of communication between the owner and other management staff and management and us. The parking situation was ridiculous. The house was not clean when we arrived and we were harassed for complaining about that. I do not recommend beach music.

name: Joseph S
text: Very nice condos super clean with awesome amenities I would recommend staying here

name: chuck bussey
text: Very clean and great location.

name: Victoria Seal-Koch
text:
If you're considering renting Beach Music 2 for your next Gulf Shores beach vacation, you will want to take the time to read about my family's experience there in July, 2018.  I'm writing this because I wish that accurate, factual information about this condo had been available to me before we paid $1,000 per day for our week-long vacation over the July 4th holiday.
My wife handled the arrangements, but there was really no way for her to have known the truth about this place.  The first warning sign came early on when she was about to book the unit through VRBO, and the owners asked her to book our stay directly with them instead - cutting VRBO out of their deal might save a few dollars for the owner but it demonstrates a dishonest attitude and willingness to cut corners that were reflected in the owner's misleading description of the unit which caused us to rent a unit that we would never have considered if the true facts had been provided.
Consider these few examples showing how the owners presented Beach Music 2 to prospective renters, and the true facts about the unit:
1). Nothing in the description or the photos reveals that this condo is essentially a vertical floorplan with three levels connected by steep, narrow stairs.  In an apparent attempt to mislead, while the owners have posted multiple photos of the interior none of these photos show the stairs.  In fact, a commentor (who may or may not have been an actual renter) declared that this unit was "handicap accessible" and the owners of Beach Music 2 replied to the comment thanking the writer - the owners did not correct the incorrect statement that the condo was handicap accessible even though it is anything but.  Some of my wife's family members who were planning on joining us halfway into our stay had to cancel their plans because they wouldn't have been able to go up or down the stairs.
(By the way, speaking about the stairs you should know that several of the balusters (the smaller dowels connecting the stair rail to the floor) were so loose they came out when touched - one more feature that made these stairs unsafe.  The same problem exists with these posts in the railings around the elevated decks and balconies.  If you have small children you should not consider staying at Beach Music 2 unless you can be by their side at all times for their safety.
2)  The condo is presented as "pristine" but in fact, the unit was dirty (alcohol/beer containers under the couch along with a dirty sock) and the furnishings were the worst I've ever experienced including those in the cheapest places like I used to rent when I was a poor college student - one sofa had broken springs that left you sitting just inches from the floor; another sofa had a hide-a-bed that was stuck partially out so that the seat cushions were at an angle that caused one to slide towards the floor.  The bed in one room appeared to actually be a fold-out sofa masquerading as a bed - the mattress was thin, and the sleeping surface was only about a foot from the floor.
My personal favorite was the master bedroom, which featured a glass-encased mini-blind set hung over the door glass.  The first time we opened this door, the mini-blind glass set came sliding down to the balcony 6 inches below.  To close the door, I had to slide up this heavy frame until it cleared the doorframe.  I reported this problem to the staff.  Near the end of our stay, we came in from playing on the beach to discover that the door had swung open and the entire glass frame had fallen onto the balcony, smashing into a thousand tiny sharp shards of glass.

name: Aaron Wamsley
text: Clean, spacious, great ocean views and beach access, nice pool.

name: Jessus Morales
text: Nice quiet place to enjoy beach!

name: Brian Hester
text: Nice house and easy beach access.

name: Jason Boles
text: Beautiful, private and roomy...

name: Ada Bailey
text: Very pretty

name: Georganne Collins
text: Wonderful place to visit.
